channel.title: User32.dll Wrapper
channel.description:
This actually took quite a bit of time to make. The hooking of MessageBoxA was done pretty quickly except for the fact that it was crashing during the hook. I solved the problem a few minutes ago and here I am sharing it. I doubt most of the people here will find it useful, oh well.
Your basically forcing the PE file to use your version of the user32.dll instead of the original one. All the functions you don't need to hook will be redirected to the original using the .def file in the project workspace. For functions you need to hook like "MessageBoxA", you need to write a new function. The hardest part ( which isn't really difficult ) is to 'finish off' the function to prevent errors and crashing.
http://servbit.org/MsgWrapper.zip

item.title: User32.dll Wrapper
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“thiefmn6092, post:9, topic:155273”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=211982.msg1856237#msg1856237 date=1193764063]
Actually, “what’s the point” was perfectly valid, in my opinion. There are better ways of hooking a single function than doing this.

Not that I’m saying this is worthless, or that you shouldn’t have posted it - just that you shouldn’t be so quick to bite peoples heads off.
[/quote]

He has the typically elitist attitude.[/quote]
But he’s proved he deserves it more than many others.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Chill out, damn.

I’m not picking on you for making a fucking hook; I just think it’s a bit excessive to hook the entire user32 dll – instead of having a hissy fit, perhaps you should prove me wrong and provide some enlightenment.

Also, me being in a “better group” has nothing to do with it.
